definitions.definition: To cease giving breast milk to an offspring ; to accustom and reconcile (a child or young animal) to a want or deprivation of mother's milk; to take from the breast or udder.
examples: The cow has weaned her calf.

definitions.definition: To cease to depend on the mother 's milk for nutrition .
To cause to quit something to which one is addicted , dependent , or habituated .
examples: He managed to wean himself off heroin.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , by extension , normally " wean off "

examples: She is weaning from her addiction to tobacco.

definitions.definition: To raise , to help grow toward maturity

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cease giving breast milk to an offspring ; to accustom and reconcile (a child or young animal) to a want or deprivation of mother's milk; to take from the breast or udder.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To cease to depend on the mother 's milk for nutrition .
( transitive , by extension , normally " wean off " ) To cause to quit something to which one is addicted , dependent , or habituated .
( intransitive , by extension ) To cease to depend .
( transitive , by extension , obsolete ) To raise , to help grow toward maturity
